item.title: Effect of parental age on offspringâ€™s neurodevelopment
Testing ANOVA Replications by Means of the Prior Predictive p-value
Testing Replication with Small Samples: Applications to ANOVA
How to test Replication for Structural Equation Models
Parental Age and Offspring Childhood Mental Health: A Multi-Cohort, Population-Based Investigation
item.description:
In this article we apply Bayesian evidence synthesis to find robust evidence on the relation between parental age (both father and mother) and offspring mental health (both internalizing and externalizing).

The paper generated world wide publicity online, in newspapers and on the radio.

item.title: Replication: Test Replications by Means of the Prior Predictive p-Value

Application and Evaluation of an Expert Judgment Elicitation Procedure for Correlations
complexity: Calculate the Proportion of Permutations in Line with an Informative Hypothesis
Proposal for a five-step method to elicit expert judgment
Where do priors come from? Applying guidelines to construct informative priors in small sample research
item.description: In this paper we present and apply guidelines to construct informative priors in a multiple group latent growth model. The application was certainly not the ideal situation that methodologists and statisticians often deal with, which made this paper only more valuable for readers that also struggle with real-life data.

item.title: Analyzing small data sets using Bayesian estimation: the case of posttraumatic stress symptoms following mechanical ventilation in burn survivors
